title: Jawaharlal Nehru‚Äôs language of optimism and equality at the Madras Corporation

He also rejected the notion that one language would hamper the growth of the other language

title: A fort in the midst of a forest was a secret training ground for cavalry and elephants
content: In the early 1700s, King¬†Chellamuthu¬† Vijayaragunatha¬† Sethupathy¬†was gifted 200 horses by a Muslim businessman from¬†Thondi.¬†He built a fort in a dense tropical thorn forest, about 70 km from¬†Ramanathapuram. Here,¬†Sankarapathi, one of¬†Hyder¬† Ali‚Äôs commandants, trained these horses. Impressed by the tutelage, the king named the fort after him

title: Call for advanced medical innovations in veterinary sector
content: Multidisciplinary research is need of the hour to bring new innovations for animal health and productivity, says Dr. D.V.R. Prakash Rao, chairperson and managing director of Chennai-based Prakash Foods & Feed Mills

title: Putin in India: ‚ÄòDefence ties to deepen despite US, EU oppn‚Äô; S-500 supply uncertain
content: India and Russia are deepening their defense ties, focusing on niche technologies and industrial cooperation. Despite global pressures, New Delhi reaffirms its strategic autonomy. Discussions included S-400 systems, Sukhoi upgrades, and BrahMos missile advancements, underscoring a commitment to bolstering India's indigenous defense capabilities and maintaining a strong partnership with Moscow.

title: Get set, no-go: You can check in any time, but you can't leave!; cancellations leave flyers stranded
content: Travelers throughout India experienced a wave of flight cancellations and lengthy delays, with IndiGo being the hardest hit. Families found themselves marooned at airports, grappling with steep rebooking fees and unclear travel arrangements. This turmoil, caused by new regulations on crew rest periods, left many bewildered and desperate for clarity amidst the operational chaos.

title: 'I have a Rolex too': DK Shivakumar quips at BJP; Rs 43 lakh watch in focus
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar refuted BJP's claims of undeclared assets, asserting full transparency in his affidavit, including a Rolex watch. He also highlighted the Congress government's women empowerment initiatives. Meanwhile, Union Minister Prahlad Joshi criticized the state government for internal divisions, corruption, and infrastructure issues, while addressing Rahul Gandhi's claims about foreign dignitaries.

title: Putin in India: PM Modi gifts Russian edition of Bhagwat Gita to President; bilateral talks today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin to India with a warm gesture, presenting him with a copy of the Bhagavad Gita in Russian. The two leaders engaged in a friendly interaction at the airport before heading to a private dinner. Putin's visit includes bilateral talks, business forums, and a tribute at Rajghat.

title: Ashes: Hayden's daughter celebrates Joe Root century with hilarious jab
content: Joe Root's long-awaited century in Australia, a fluent 135, averted a bizarre promise from Matthew Hayden.  Hayden's daughter, Grace, humorously celebrated Root's milestone, saving her father from a public spectacle.  Root's historic ton, his first Down Under after a decade, brought calm to England's innings and marked a significant career achievement.

title: H-1B Visa Fee Hike: NASSCOM chief flags a one-year window; what it means for Indian IT firms
content: Nasscom president Rajesh Nambiar assures that recent H-1B visa changes will minimally impact large Indian IT firms, citing increased local hiring and a one-year buffer for adjustments.  While startups face challenges, hybrid models are emerging. India is poised to lead in AI skills, emphasizing human expertise alongside technological advancements.

title: JSW Steel, Kotak Mahindra & more: Top stocks to buy today ‚Äî Check list
content: Brokerage firms are bullish on JSW Steel and Tata Consumer Products, forecasting significant growth. Aurobindo Pharma shows strong momentum. Kotak Mahindra Bank might acquire IDBI Bank, a move that could boost earnings. Dr Reddy's Labs is on track for key biosimilar launches and will focus on brand acquisitions. These insights offer a glimpse into potential market movements.

title: Biggest ever US travel ban in the works? More than 30 countries could be under review
content: The US is reportedly planning to significantly expand its travel ban, potentially adding over 30 countries to the existing list. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed the expansion is underway, citing concerns over countries lacking stable governments and adequate vetting processes.

title: Barra's bombshell: GM CEO shares Tesla snub that fueled Biden‚ÄìMusk rift
content: General Motors CEO Mary Barra revealed she privately corrected President Biden after a 2021 White House event that excluded Tesla. Barra told Biden that Tesla deserved recognition for its EV advancements, a sentiment echoed by Kamala Harris who later acknowledged the snub. This exclusion fueled a rift between Biden and Elon Musk, impacting political alliances and EV policy debates.

title: 'Where is Shami?': Left out of Team India ‚Äî pacer answers with Man-of-the-Match in SMAT
content: Easwaran, who is also trying to strengthen his case ahead of the IPL auction, scored 58 off 37 balls. Bengal chased 166 in 15.1 overs. Abhishek Porel, representing Delhi Capitals in the IPL, scored 56 off 29 balls. The pair added 93 runs for the second wicket in 8.2 overs, which set up the chase.

title: 'Fear for life': FIR against Gurgaon BJP councillor for pressuring daughter to marry; cops get email
content: A BJP councillor and his wife are accused of holding their daughter captive and pressuring her into an arranged marriage. The daughter, Neha Kataria, emailed authorities for help, leading to her rescue from her home a day before her scheduled wedding. An FIR has been filed against the parents for wrongful confinement.

title: Bezos' ex-wife makes bold move: Amazon stake sale funds Howard University gift
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Russian President‚Äôs visit turns parts of city into a fortress
content: President Putin's visit to New Delhi has transformed key areas into a heavily fortified zone, mirroring G20 security measures. His custom-built Aurus Senat limousine, a "rolling bunker," was flown in for his protection. A five-layer security grid, combining Russian and Indian elite forces, ensures his safety, with snipers and anti-drone systems deployed.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn‚Äôt a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Los Angeles Lakers vs Toronto Raptors regular season game - Full injury report
content: The Lakers and Raptors face significant injury woes as they clash on December 4, 2025. With Luka Doncic and Marcus Smart out for LA, and Jakob Poeltl and RJ Barrett sidelined for Toronto, depth players will be crucial. This game becomes a test of adaptability and which supporting cast can step up.

title: Crowd, confusion, chaos: IndiGo meltdown hits flyers nationwide; passengers fume
content: IndiGo is currently navigating a major operational crisis, canceling 300 flights due to a misjudgment of pilot staffing needs in light of updated duty regulations. As a result, countless passengers find themselves in distress, facing delays and protests as they seek alternative travel arrangements.

title: Elden Campbell's cause of death revealed: Former NBA champion passed away at 57
content: Former NBA center Elden Campbell, 57, tragically passed away due to drowning during a fishing trip in Broward County. Known for his steady presence and generous spirit, Campbell enjoyed a 15-year career, notably contributing to the Detroit Pistons' 2004 championship. His family and former teammates remember him as a devoted family man who died doing what he loved.

title: Elgar Parishad case: HC gives bail to DU ex-professor Hany Babu; 3 still in jail
content: The Bombay High Court has made a landmark decision by granting bail to Hany Babu, a former Delhi University professor linked to the Elgar Parishad case, after a staggering five-year incarceration. The court underscored that holding someone without trial for such an extended period breaches essential rights.

title: What explains a grand spiral galaxy only 1.5 billion years after the Big Bang
content: The James Webb Space Telescope has discovered Alaknanda, a remarkably mature spiral galaxy existing just 1.5 billion years after the Big Bang. This well-organized structure, complete with a disc and arms, challenges existing theories about early cosmic evolution.  Its existence suggests galactic formation may have been more efficient and rapid than previously believed, prompting a re-evaluation of cosmic timelines.

title: File charges only if there‚Äôs reasonable conviction chance: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned police and trial courts against filing chargesheets and framing charges without a strong prima facie case, citing judicial system congestion. Justices emphasized that prosecution should only proceed with a reasonable prospect of conviction, especially in civil disputes, acting as crucial filters to maintain judicial efficiency and integrity.

title: Top 5 richest NFL players of all-time: Meet the millionaires and know their net worth
content: NFL stars are transforming on-field success into significant off-field wealth through investments and brand deals.  Tom Brady leads the pack with $300 million, showcasing how elite play and strategic business ventures build lasting financial empires.  Other top earners like Aaron Rodgers and Kirk Cousins also demonstrate diverse income streams beyond their playing salaries.

title: 'Tere Ishk Mein' collections drop ahead of 'Dhurandhar' clash
content: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' has crossed the Rs 100 crore worldwide mark in its first week, despite a slight dip on Day 7. The romantic drama delivered a strong opening and steady weekdays, becoming Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit. However, its box office run faces a major challenge with the release of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' this weekend.

title: Why isn‚Äôt Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Raptors despite being healthy?
content: Lakers' star Luka Doncic is unexpectedly absent from tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors due to personal reasons. He is currently in Slovenia, preparing to welcome his second child. This absence poses a significant challenge for the Lakers, who will need to adapt their strategy to secure a win without their leading scorer. Fans eagerly await his return.

title: LeBron James expected to play tonight vs Raptors: Latest Lakers update
content: LeBron James is expected to play for the Lakers against the Raptors, despite lingering sciatica. Both teams face significant injury concerns, with Toronto missing RJ Barrett and Jakob Poeltl, while Los Angeles is without Luka Doncic and Marcus Smart. This matchup carries playoff preview weight as both teams boast strong records.

title: IndiGo meltdown hits flyers: Mumbai City FC stranded 10 hours; fares spike, chaos nationwide
content: A nationwide air travel crisis, primarily involving IndiGo, has left thousands stranded.  Mumbai City FC's journey to a Super Cup semi-final was severely impacted by cancellations and delays. Passengers faced prolonged waits, exorbitant fares, and missed crucial events, highlighting widespread disruption across major Indian cities.

title: Daily road deaths touched 485 in 2024 even as NH fatalities dipped
content: India witnessed a grim rise in road fatalities in 2024, with 1.77 lakh deaths, averaging 485 daily. While National Highways showed a slight decrease in their share of accidents, overall deaths climbed 2.3% from the previous year. Experts emphasize the need for education and broader awareness campaigns to combat this crisis.

title: Live-in ok for adults even if not of marriage age: Rajasthan HC
content: Rajasthan high court affirmed that two consenting adults, even below marriageable age, have the right to a live-in relationship. Rejecting the argument that the male's age prevented cohabitation, the court cited Article 21, stating fundamental rights cannot be denied. Live-in relationships are not illegal, and the state must ensure protection.

title: 'Loose cannon': TMC suspends MLA who vowed ‚ÄòBabri-style‚Äô mosque; he stays defiant
content: Trinamool Congress has suspended MLA Humayun Kabir for his controversial plan to lay the foundation of a mosque on December 6, the anniversary of the Babri Masjid demolition.  Despite the party's action, Kabir remains defiant, vowing to proceed with the plan and launch his own political party.  Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee emphasized unity, stating that disruptive elements would be removed.

title: Gujarat HC halts Rs 45L alimony order: Wife accused of killing mother-in-law
content: The Gujarat High Court has temporarily halted a Rs 45 lakh alimony order for a woman accused of murdering her mother-in-law. Her estranged husband challenged the payment, citing the grave nature of the crime. The court acknowledged the serious allegations, including the husband's claim of cruelty, and will hear the case further in January.

title: Nitish hails PM Modi‚Äôs support: Seeks ‚Äògratitude‚Äô from assembly; oppn stays unmoved
content: In a recent assembly session, Bihar's Chief Minister Nitish Kumar lauded Prime Minister Modi for his support, encouraging MLAs to show appreciation. When the opposition hesitated to acknowledge this, Kumar humorously reminisced about his past political partnerships, particularly his exit from the RJD.

title: IndiGo Flights Delayed, Thousands Of Fliers Wait For Luggage Without Food
content: NDTV witnessed the situation on the ground where thousands of suitcases were seen lying at the Delhi airport terminal.

title: "If US Has Right To Buy Our Fuel, Why Shouldn't India": Putin On Tariffs
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin challenged heavy US pressure on India not to buy Russian fuel if the US could do so as he began a two-day state visit, where he was embraced on arrival by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Talks With PM Modi, State Dinner: What's On Putin's Agenda On Day-2 Of India Visit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India on a state visit aimed at bolstering bilateral and economic ties between New Delhi and Moscow.

title: "Twisting Facts": Siddaramaiah Rebuts BJP's "63 Per Cent" Corruption Charge
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Thursday refuted BJP leader R Ashoka's accusation regarding a judge's alleged remark about "63 per cent corruption" in the state

title: Protest Against Burqa Ban In Mumbai College, Case Against 6 Students
content: Six female students were booked for protesting against a burqa-niqab ban in an educational institution in Mumbai's Goregoan area, a police official said on Thursday.

title: PM Modi's Rare Airport Reception Gesture: For Vladimir Putin And Who Else
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received Russian President Vladimir Putin at the airport when he arrived at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport this evening. He will be in India for two days on a visit that has discussion on key issues including

title: 3 Elephants Found Dead In Tamil Nadu Private Forest; 6 Deaths In 3 Months
content: Three elephants, including a calf, were found dead under mysterious circumstances in a privately owned forest in Vellore district on Thursday, triggering a joint Tamil Nadu-Andhra Pradesh investigation.

title: "Inspiration For Millions": PM Modi Gifts Russian Edition Of Bhagavad Gita To Putin
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has presented a copy of Bhagavad Gita in Russian to President Vladimir Putin, who is on a two-day visit to India.

title: 4 Killed In Latest US Strike On Alleged Drug-Trafficking Boat In Pacific
content: A strike on an alleged drug-trafficking boat in the eastern Pacific Ocean killed four people on Thursday, the US military said, amid a growing controversy over a campaign that has taken more than 87 lives.

title: Vladimir Putin In India LIVE Updates: Russia President To Hold Summit Talks With PM Modi Today
content: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: IndiGo Apologises After 2 Days Of Widespread Disruption Over Staff Shortage
content: IndiGo issued a "heartfelt apology" to customers and industry stakeholders after widespread disruptions across its network and operations over the past two days, and said the airline "remains focussed on streamlining its operations at the earliest."

title: Bill Gates Warns Of Child Death Rise Due To Aid Cuts, Criticises DOGE
content: Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates told AFP on Thursday it is "tragic" that child deaths will increase worldwide for the first time this century because wealthy Western countries have slashed international aid.

title: Putin Says Russia Will Take Donbas By Force Or Ukraine's Troops Will Withdraw
content: President Vladimir Putin said in an interview published on Thursday that Russia would take full control of Ukraine's Donbas region by force unless Ukrainian forces withdraw, something Kyiv has flatly rejected.

title: Asim Munir Gets More Powerful, Becomes Pak's 1st Chief Of Defence Forces
content: Three elephants, including a calf, were found dead under mysterious circumstances in a privately owned forest in Vellore district on Thursday, triggering a joint Tamil NaduAndhra Pradesh investigation.

title: Israel Launches Fresh Strikes On Lebanon After Warnings
content: Israeli raids hit south Lebanon on Thursday as its military said it was striking Hezbollah weapons storage facilities, a day after Lebanese and Israeli civilian representatives held their first direct talks in decades.

title: Anti-Hamas Militia Leader Yasser Abu Shabab Killed In Gaza
content: The head of an armed Palestinian faction that opposes Hamas in Gaza has been killed, Israeli media reported on Thursday, in what would be a blow to Israeli efforts to support Gazan clans against the Islamist movement.

title: Court Order On Lighting Lamp "Not A Setback": DMK On Deepam Contempt Case
content: The ruling DMK has said the development is "not a setback" for the party. The judiciary must also "respect the powers of the state," the party insisted.

title: 5 Mysterious Drones Spotted Near Zelensky's Jet As He Lands In Dublin
content: An Irish navy ship spotted up to five drones operating near the flight path of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's aircraft as he arrived for a state visit to Ireland on Monday, local media reported on Thursday.

title: Israel Says It Killed Nearly 40 Hamas Fighters Trapped In Gaza Tunnels
content: The Israeli military said on Thursday that its forces have killed around 40 Hamas militants who had been trapped in tunnels below Rafah in southern Gaza, in an area now under Israeli control.

title: Smriti wedding postponed: Palak Muchhal breaks silence on 'tough times'
content: Singer Palak Muchhal has broken her silence on the postponement of her brother Palash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana's wedding. Unexpected health emergencies involving Mandhana's father and Palash on consecutive days led to the ceremony's indefinite delay. Both families are reportedly focusing on positivity and staying strong during this challenging time.

title: WFH status shouldn‚Äôt tilt balance in custody battle: SC
content: a child custody dispute between working parents cannot be decided in favour of one of them on the criterion that they work from home . a bench of justices remarked that it could not be said that the interests of the child would be better served by the parent who worked from home, than the other who went to office daily .

title: PUC violations cost Rs 330cr: Rajasthan tops; e-detection rollout begins
content: road transport ministry said between 2021 and 2025 penalties were imposed on owners of 5.74 lakh private and commercial vehicles . more than half of these fines came from govt vehicles flouting PUC norm in Delhi, followed by Rajasthan where Rs 40,900 fine was collected .

title: At UNGA, India skips vote to stop Ukrainian kids‚Äô forced relocation
content: the 193-member Assembly adopted the draft resolution ‚ÄòReturn of Ukrainian children‚Äô on Wednesday, with 91 votes in favour, 12 against, and 57 ‚Äî including India, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Brazil, China, Egypt, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka‚Äôs ‚Äî abstentions . the resolution demands that Russia ‚Äúensure the immediate, safe and unconditional return of all Ukrainian children who have been forcibly transferred or deported‚Äù .

title: Kerala: HC denies Cong MLA bail in sex assault case; party expels him
content:
Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil

Thiruvananthapuram: Congress, already on the defensive after the survivor lodged a formal complaint against the MLA, moved swiftly Thursday, expelling Mamkootathil from the party‚Äôs primary membership within minutes of the court order. AICC had reportedly cleared the action soon after KPCC president Sunny Joseph received a rape complaint from another woman on Tuesday. Earlier, AICC general secretary in charge of Kerala, Deepa Dasmunsi, reportedly told the Congress brass strong action was unavoidable as the allegations had severely damaged the party‚Äôs image, especially ahead of assembly polls next year. The brass was learnt to have asked the state unit to take stern action against him, but KPCC held it off until the court verdict, apparently to avoid further embarrassment and pre-empt internal dissent.

End of Article

title: Niti panel backs licences, permits for perpetuity
content: a panel headed by Niti Aayog member Rajiv Gauba has suggested that inspections be carried out by accredited third parties selected through computer-assisted randomised processes based on risk assessment . officials said that by ensuring predictability, proportionality and fairness, such a system reduces enforcement burden, promotes innovation and sustains confidence, improving governance outcomes .

title: Bihar voter list row: SC seeks EC records; ADR claims 5 lakh duplicates remain
content: EC refuses to run the deduplication software through the voter list which could eliminate the 5 lakh duplicate voters . advocate Prashant Bhushan alleged that even the duplicate names pointed out by petitioner Yogendra Yadav thro-ugh a presentation before SC continued to remain on the final voter list .

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: The best games, from Duke, Arkansas, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC Men's Challenge featured a bevy of AP top 25 men's college basketball teams . on Tuesday, the ACC came out swinging, with no. 4 Duke escaping an attempted double-digit comeback by no. 15 Florida by a single point . a one-possession victory for no. 16 North Carolina over no. 18 Kentucky ended the night up 6-2 on the SEC .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day
content: DT Lamar Brown, the no. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year . college football's early signing period started Wednesday and runs until Friday . if a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle .

title: Week 15 preview: A look at Championship Week matchups and players to watch
content: if the playoff has taken some of the shine off a championship trophy, there will still be plenty of action this weekend with high stakes . in the big 12, BYU hopes to avenge its only loss -- a blowout to Texas Tech -- and steal a playoff bid . the conference's best team -- Miami -- won't take the field .

title: J-Rod's journey: From sleeping on floors and taking out loans to Heisman contention
content: quarterback had just ended his freshman season at Virginia . he had a creeping doubt that maybe it was time to give up his quarterback dreams . "the pat McAfee Show" is slated for the big 12 championship vs. the BYU Cougars .

title: 'Not everyone can win': Are CFB's blue bloods really losing their grip on the sport?

title: Follow live: Lions open second half with surgical march downfield to extend lead over Cowboys
content: The  Dallas Cowboys  entered their Week 14 "Thursday Night Football" game against the  Detroit Lions  on a roll, winners of three in a row and believing that the playoffs are not out of reach. Dallas had a 17.8% chance of reaching the playoffs heading into the game, according to FPI. The Lions had less momentum, not having put together back-to-back wins since beating the Browns in Week 4 and the Bengals in Week 5. Detroit had a 42.9% chance of reaching the postseason heading into the game. Cowboys reporter Todd Archer and Lions reporter Eric Woodyard are on-site and will provide all the highlights throughout the night in this file.

title: Grading coaching hires: How Collin Klein fits back at Kansas State
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . schools around the Power 4 that fired their coaches in the first two months of the season are targeting candidates and finalizing deals . one of the first major coaches to lose his job was the first noninterim coach to be hired .

title: Women's Power Rankings: Texas unseats UConn at No. 1 after big wins
content: the Players Era Championship in Las Vegas last week prompted a new no. 1 in ESPN's Power Rankings . the gamecocks and longhorns met four times in 2024-25: twice in the regular season, in the SEC tournament final and the national semifinals, with South Carolina winning three of the four . it's not the first time South Carolina coach Dawn Staley and Texas coach Vic Schaefer have been part of a rivalry .

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 MLB teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .
